* the dialog container. Clears the user input after processing.

* A launcher class to workaround classpath issues.
* Returns custom messages for each action taken by the application.
public String findMsg(ArrayList<Task> lst, String keyword) {
if (lst.size() == 0) { // no task containing the keyword found
return "Uh oh! SQUIRTLE could not find anything with " + keyword + "!!";
return "SQUIRTLE discovered " + lst.size() + " thing(s) containing " + keyword + ": \n" + this.printList(lst);
public String taskMsg(Task task, int lstSize) {
return "SQUIRTLE is adding: " + task.toString() + "!!" + "\nSQUIRTLE now has "
public String errorMsg(DukeException e) { // error responses
case NUMBER: // error in accessing list, no such task exists
return "SQUIRTLE is confused!! Give SQUIRTLE one keyword!!";
return "SQUIRTLE cannot write on your file!!";
return "Error in error msg portion of Ui!";
return "SQUIRTLE!! I'M HERE TO HELP!! SQUIRTLE!!";

* An enums class to represent possible causes of exceptions in the Duke application
NUMBER, // error in accessing list, no such task exists
INSUFFICIENT, // error in creation of tasks, insufficient commands
COMMAND, // error in command - no task of given type exists
DATEFORMAT, // error in date given by the user - unable to parse
KEYWORDS, // error when user providing keywords - too many keywords
FILEPARSE, // error when parser is trying to read task from file
TASKPARSE; // error when parser is trying to read task into a string
* A custom exception class representing exceptions unique to Duke.
public class Deadline extends Task implements TimeParser {
* A constructor for creating a new Deadline.
* Sets isDone to false by default.
* Parses String representation of deadline into a LocalDate object.
* @param deadline    String representation of the deadline
public Deadline(String description, String deadline) throws DateTimeParseException { // constructor for creating new deadline
assert this.deadline != null: "date is null after parsing in constructor";
* This constructor is called in the Parser class when parsing file to string.
* Sets isDone to true or false according to status number (0 or 1)
* @param status      0 - isDone is false, 1 - isDone is true
* @param deadline    String representation of the deadline
public Deadline(String status, String description, String deadline) throws DateTimeParseException { // constructor when parsing tasks from hard disk
assert this.deadline != null: "date is null after parsing in constructor";
public class Event extends Task implements TimeParser {

* Sets isDone to false by default.
* Parses String representation of deadline into a LocalDate object.

assert this.eventTime != null: "event time is null after parsing in constructor";

* @param eventTime   String representation of the event time
public Event(String status, String description, String eventTime) throws DateTimeParseException { // constructor for parsing tasks from hard disk
assert this.eventTime != null: "event time is null after parsing in constructor";

* Adds given task to the ArrayList.

* An interface to parse date and time.
* Implemented by Deadline and Event classes.
* Parses given string representation of date.
* Allows for 2 formats, one for parsing user input in the format "d/M/yyyy".
* The second format is for parsing dates in the default LocalDate pattern from file.
* @return LocalDate object representing the given date
* @throws DateTimeParseException if no valid date format is given
static LocalDate parseDate(String date) throws DateTimeParseException {
return LocalDate.parse(date); // parse the default pattern
* Prints the date in the format "d MMM yyyy".
* Called in the Deadline and Event classes when displaying to the user.
